title: Eddie Hearn says he would promote charity boxing match between Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy
text:
Eddie Hearn has admitted he would be willing to promote a charity boxing match between Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy.

Rooney sent social media into meltdown on Wednesday when she released an incredible statement accusing friend Rebekah of leaking stories about her to the press.

The 33-year-old wife of former Manchester United striker Wayne Rooney, revealed she had set up an elaborate plan to catch the culprit by spreading false information on Instagram, which was then leaked through Vardy's account.

Eddie Hearn admitted he was fascinated by the Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy saga

Vardy has denied Rooney's accusations that she's sold private stories about her to The Sun

Rebekah denied the allegations, stating: 'I never speak to anyone about you as various journalists who have asked me to over the years can vouch for. If you thought this was happening you could have told me and I could have changed my passwords to see if it stopped.

'I'm not being funny but I don't need the money, what would I gain from selling stories on you?'

As the dispute rumbles on, talk has now turned to the two potentially settling their differences inside the ring - an event that would likely garner huge interest.

Coleen made the shock claims after discovering she'd been betrayed by someone close to her

Rebekah denied all accusations against her minutes after the post by posting this on Twitter

Matchroom promoter, Hearn, who works with superstars like Anthony Joshua and Katie Taylor, admitted he was intrigued by the saga.

'I must say, I did find that fascinating,' Hearn told iFL TV. 'I love Coleen Rooney, the way she wrote it out. I was like, 'Well, obviously she's not gonna say and it's just a mate.'

'And it was, "It's……….. Rebekah Vardy."

Hearn was initially hesitant when asked if he'd promote a fight between Rooney and Vardy before adding: 'For Sport Relief I would, for charity.

'Do you know what? They'd probably be quite decent as well.

'That'd be massive, wouldn't it? How many [pay-per-view] buys?'
description: Rooney sent social media into meltdown on Wednesday when she released an incredible statement accusing friend Rebekah of leaking stories about her to the press.
